Hi,

I just start using Squiffy. I really like this tool yet, since I like to write, and have some knowledge on computer science, so I think I will be able to make full use of Squiffy!

I start using Squiffy with the windows app, but now I use the comand line version, because I want to have more control over the result.

I have been able to override *index.template.html*, in particular to translate the restart button in french. 

Now, I need to translate the alert text that appear when we click on the restart link. So I have done like I have done for the *index.template.html file*, I copied the squiffy.template.js from the *...\AppData\Roaming\npm\node_modules\squiffy* folder to my local project folder. I translated the alert text, but it make no change when I publish my project using the squiffy  command.

I wonder how to do it. Does I have to fork the project and make the change I want on my fork ? I would prefer not, because the change I want to do will not be necessarely for all my projects.

Thank you in advance :)
